objective.answer: The primary objective of the paper is to introduce a methodology based on agentic workflows for economic research that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) and multimodal AI to enhance research efficiency and reproducibility.
objective.evidence: This paper introduces a methodology based on agentic workflows for economic research that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) and multimodal AI to enhance research efficiency and reproducibility.

knowledge_gap.answer: The paper addresses the gap in the application of agentic workflows in economic research, which has been relatively slow to adapt AI technologies to its specific methodological needs.
knowledge_gap.evidence: While a growing ecosystem of AI-powered research tools exists... economics as a discipline has been relatively slow to adapt these technologies to its specific methodological needs.

answer: Introduction of agentic workflows specifically tailored for economic research.
Integration of LLMs and multimodal AI to cover the entire research lifecycle in economics.
Development of a framework that includes autonomous and iterative processes with strategic human oversight.
evidence: This paper introduces a methodology based on agentic workflows for economic research...
Our approach features autonomous and iterative processes covering the entire research lifecycle...
The workflow architecture comprises specialized agents with clearly defined roles...

inspirational_papers.answer:
- Korinek (2023) Generative AI for economic research: Use cases and implications for economists. (Methodological precursors)
- Cowen and Tabarrok (2023) How to learn and teach economics with large language models, including GPT. (Methodological precursors)
inspirational_papers.evidence: Within economics specifically, LLMs show significant promise: Korinek (2023) provides a systematic taxonomy of use cases... Complementing this, Cowen and Tabarrok (2023) offers practical guidance on integrating these unique tools into economic research and education.

steps.step: Design specialized agents for economic research tasks.
steps.input: Research questions, literature reviews, and human-specified constraints.
steps.output: Theoretical frameworks, mathematical models, and calibrated parameters.
steps.evidence: Each agent in the system is engineered to manage a clearly defined responsibility, making the research process more effective throughout the economic research lifecycle.

steps.output: Validated research questions, theoretical frameworks, and empirical analyses.
steps.evidence: Human experts are embedded at specific checkpoints throughout the workflow to guide and validate the autonomous processes.

steps.step: Coordinate workflow phases from ideation to replication.
steps.input: Outputs from previous phases and human feedback.
steps.output: Finalized research outputs ready for publication.
steps.evidence: The entire methodology is structured as an interconnected, multi-phase workflow.

tools.name: AutoGen
tools.description: Used for implementing the agentic workflow framework.
tools.evidence: We demonstrate the practical implementation of our framework using Microsoftâ€™s open-source platform, AutoGen.

methods.name: Hypothesis or Idea Generation
methods.description: The system produces candidate hypotheses or new research ideas from prior knowledge or external input.
methods.evidence: The ideation phase employs a coordinated network of agents, each responsible for distinct yet complementary tasks within the research question formulation process.

methods.name: Experimental design generation
methods.description: The approach includes producing experimental protocols, configurations, or evaluation strategies.
methods.evidence: The entire methodology is structured as an interconnected, multi-phase workflow.

areas.name: Social Sciences
areas.description: The paper focuses on improving economic research methodologies.
areas.evidence: Economic research requires labor-intensive processes for literature review, data processing, and empirical validation...

areas.name: Interdisciplinary Sciences
areas.description: The methodology integrates AI technologies across various stages of economic research.
areas.evidence: Our approach features autonomous and iterative processes covering the entire research lifecycle...

performance_summary.summary: The agentic workflows demonstrated significant improvements in research efficiency and methodological consistency.
performance_summary.evidence: These demonstrations highlight how agentic systems enhance research productivity and methodological consistency, freeing researchers for higher-level analysis while maintaining rigorous quality standards guided by domain expertise.

future_directions.name: Enhanced reasoning capabilities
future_directions.description: Future research should explore enhanced reasoning capabilities for handling edge cases and methodological innovations.
future_directions.evidence: As AI capabilities continue to advance, future research should explore several promising directions: (ii) Enhanced reasoning capabilities for handling edge cases and methodological innovations...

future_directions.name: Deeper integration with domain-specific knowledge
future_directions.description: Explore deeper integration with domain-specific economic knowledge or pre-trained LLMs.
future_directions.evidence: As AI capabilities continue to advance, future research should explore several promising directions: (iii) Deeper integration with domain-specific economic knowledge or pre-trained LLMs...

resource_link.evidence: To facilitate reproducibility and further development of agentic workflows for economic research, we have made all code, configuration files, and documentation available in a public GitHub repository.
